intro: Acmispon glaber subsp. glaber, commonly known as narrowleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant has trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert and semi-desert environments. Acmispon glaber subsp. glaber is adapted to arid conditions and has a deep root system for water absorption.
